record.attribute: WU-BLASTX (Genomic sequence vs. NRDB)
Genomic sequence and NCBI non-redundant protein database
BLASTX alignments
WU-BLASTX is used to identify statistically significant DNA-protein sequence similarities found between DNA sequence queries and protein sequence libraries

row.attribute: Warren R. Gish, Washington University, Saint Louis, Missouri

record.attribute: HMMPfam
fasta file of protein sequences and PFAM database
file containing the score and E-value indicating confidence that a query sequence contains one or more domains belonging to a domain family
Searches HMMs from the PFAM database for significantly similar sequences in the input protein sequence.

row.attribute: R. Durbin, S. Eddy, A. Krogh, and G. Mitchison, Biological sequence analysis: probabilistic models of proteins and nucleic acids, Cambridge University Press, 1998. http://hmmer.wustl.edu/

record.attribute: splign
output of megablast analysis of a fasta formatted transcript file with a genomic sequence database formatted using formatdb
a tab-delimited text with every line representing a separate segment on the query sequence.

Splign uses transcript to genomic sequence BLAST hit output to generate information about exon-intron boundaries, splice-junctions, potential frameshifts, and alternative models when there is more than one possibility

row.attribute: Yu.Kapustin, A.Souvorov, T.Tatusova. Splign - a Hybrid Approach To Spliced Alignments. RECOMB 2004 - Currents in Computational Molecular Biology. p.741.

record.attribute: WU-BLASTP (Protein sequences vs. NRDB)
Protein sequences and NRDB
BLASTP alignments
WU-BLASTP is used to identify statistically significant protein sequence similarities found between protein sequence queries and protein sequence libraries

row.attribute: Warren R. Gish, Washington University, Saint Louis, Missouri

record.attribute: Predict transmembrane domains
Protein sequences
Predicted transmembrane domain topology
TMHMM is used to predict transmembrane domain presence and topology

row.attribute: Anders Krogh, Bjorn Larsson, Gunnar von Heijne, and Erik L.L. Sonnhammer

record.attribute: SignalP
Protein sequences
Signal peptide predictions
SignalP is used to identify signal peptides and their likely cleavage sites.

row.attribute: Bendtsen JD, Nielsen H, von Heijne G, Brunak S.

record.attribute: WU-BLASTN (Oligo sequences vs. Genomic or transcript sequences)
Oligo sequences and Genomic or transcript sequences
BLASTN alignments
WU-BLASTN is used to identify statistically significant DNA sequence similarities found between DNA sequence queries and DNA sequence libraries

row.attribute: Warren R. Gish, Washington University, Saint Louis, Missouri

record.attribute: ExportPred
fasta file of protein sequences
file containing export sequences and scores
Program that predicts the exported proteins of Plasmodium.
TRF
fasta file of DNA sequences
a repeat table file and an alignment file
The Tandem Repeats Finder program locates and displays tandem repeats in DNA sequences
Filter Low Complexity Protein Sequences
Protein sequences
Protein sequences containing regions of low complexity are masked with the character 'x'
seg was used to mask low complexity regions.
Filter Low Complexity Genomic Sequences
Genomic sequences
Genomic sequences containing regions of low complexity are masked with the character 'N'
dust was used to mask low complexity regions.
psipred
fasta file of protein sequences and a filtered and formatted protein database
file containing a residue by residue prediction of helix, strand, xand coil accompanied by confidence level
Psipred predicts secondary structure using a neural network analysis of PSI-BLAST output

row.attribute: Jones DT.(1999)Protein secondary structure prediction based on position-specific scoring matrices.J.Mol.Biol.292:195-202.

record.attribute: tRNAScan-SE
Transcript or genomic sequence file in fasta format
tab delimited file with the type of tRNA, anticodon, score, and locations on the sequences analyzed
tRNAscan-SE identifies transfer RNA genes in genomic DNA or RNA sequences.
InterProScan
fasta file of protein sequences and InterPro databases
file containing the domain matched, description of the interpro entry, GO description of the Interpro entry and E-value of the match
InterProScan scans protein sequences against the protein signatures of the InterPro member databases including PROSITE, PRINTS, xPfam, ProDom,SMART, TIGRFAMs, PIR, SUPERFAMILY.

row.attribute: Zdobnov E.M. and Apweiler R. , InterProScan - an integration platform for the signature-recognition methods in InterPro, Bioinformatics, 2001, 17(9): 847-8

record.attribute: ORF Generation
Genomic DNA or EST sequences
gff file containing the 6 reading frame, 50 or more amino acid translations of the input nucleic acid
The translations in all 6 reading frames do not necessarily begin with MET but always end at a stop codon. ORF names are in the form template-frame-start-end, e.g. AAEL01000396-5-5847-4366
CAP4 EST Assembly
Clusters of EST sequences
assembled consensus sequence and quality values
CAP4 is used to generate the EST assemblies. CAP4 aligns and assembles clustered sequence reads and produces consensus sequences

row.attribute: Huang, X. and Madan, A. (1999) CAP3: A DNA sequence assembly program. Genome Res., 9, 868-877.

record.attribute: BLAT EST Alignments
Fasta file of EST sequences blocked using repeatMasker with RepBase and genome sequences in nib format
Text file of alignments in .psl format
ESTs are clustered based on BLAT alignments. BLAT is a tool to rapidly find mRNA/DNA alignments that can be run using the GfClient program to query an indexed DNA database on a GfServer

row.attribute: Kent W.J., BLAT - The BLAST-Like Alignment Tool, Genome Research, 2002, 12(4), 656-664

record.attribute: MercatorAndMavid
genomes, exon coordinates, and a phylogenetic newick tree
file of pairwise synteny alignments with defined spans

Mercator and Mavid are used for comparative genome analysis. Mercator uses genomes and exon coordinates to create exon translations for protein BLAT alignments and outputs orthology maps. The orthology maps are used as a guide for Mavid which also uses a phylogenetic newick tree to generate gene alignments

row.attribute: Dewey CN. Aligning multiple whole genomes with Mercator and MAVID. Methods in Molecular Biology. 395:221-36, 2007.

record.attribute: RepeatMasker
Fasta file of nucleic acid sequences and RepBase
Fasta file of masked nucleic acid sequences

RepeatMasker uses cross-match and a RepBase repeat library to screen DNA sequences for interspersed repeats and low complexity DNA sequences and outputs a modified version of the query sequence in which all the repeats have been masked.

row.attribute: Smit, AFA, Hubley, R & Green, P. RepeatMasker Open-3.0. 1996-2004

record.attribute: Protein pI (isoelectric point) calculation
Protein sequences
pI (isoelectric point) values
The pKa values used to calculate pI are those used in the EMBOSS package; the pI is calculated to only two decimal points.
